1022644241724526592.text: If you want to reach out, please do. If you want to see if you can get some money back, go to @AskPayPal 's Resolution Center and file a claim. The more we do this, the more likely we'll see some $$ back. Plus, it's cathartic. Be well./18

1022644239178584064.text: I guess what I'm trying to say is, I'm okay, and I hope you will be too. In her weird, twisted way, I hope #annamarch will somehow see the error of her ways and come out being a better person for it. I know she's out there somewhere, probably cooking up a new name./17

1022644238301970433.text: I had a great experience in a beautiful place, and met women I hope to be lifelong friends with. I'm currently escalating a claim with Paypal to get my Ireland money back. If I don't, it will sting a little but won't devastate me financially. I've really only hurt my pride./16

1022644237450526720.text: When it comes down to it, I can't complain that much. I originally booked the workshop because I wanted to see Julia Child's house, and I did. I'm not like the countless writers whose books #annamarch "midwifed" who are out hundreds or perhaps thousands of dollars./15

1022644236544602117.text: Millions of people would kill to be in that column, and #annamarch seemed to be promising the key. Truth be told, I saw Dan Jones speak at the @ASJAhq conference in May, and a lot of what he said echoed what she told us./14

1022644235164680192.text: She DID have that piece in Modern Love, DID claim to be friends with Dan Jones and his wife, and DID have the piece narrated by Mandy Moore. That part was real. So I'm left thinking she was halfway into her scam when she got this wonderful coup, and just decided to use it./13

1022644233952550912.text: She, in turn, seemed to want to inspire us and teach us everything she knew. Sure, there was a LOT of namedropping, and I wondered how much of it was one big cover-up for insecurity - not uncommon in the literary community. Was she BFFs with Roxane Gay? Cheryl Strayed?/12

1022644232018911232.text: I am now left wondering how much of the great time I had with these wonderful women in France was at all true, and how much was a lie. How much was premeditated scam, and how much, if any, was from the heart? We gave her our writing and opened up our souls to each other. /11

1022644231184281600.text: I have to admit, when this article popped up on Facebook this morning, I didn't even feel that sinking feeling in my stomach. I wasn't even shocked. Something about it made so much sense, it was almost a relief. The lack of organization. The long lag time between emails. /10

1022644230278316032.text: She then said she might have to cancel the workshop altogether. "Give me a week," she said No mention of repayment. I expressed sympathy and told her I would check back in. I have now done so twice, and don't expect to ever hear from her again./9

1022644229376540672.text: #annamarch responded to my email once, saying first that she "had to cancel the castle" because "people want me to" (which people? wouldn't the only people who matter be the ones who had booked the workshop specifically because of the location?)/8

1022644228441235456.text: I have since tried to get in touch with her several times about the Ireland workshop. A friend from the Julia Child workshop who also had booked Ireland wanted to go together, rent a car, and drive around afterward. Another friend suggested meeting up in London before. /7

1022644227543584769.text: Now I learn I wasn't that far off the mark, as this is how many other people were taken in, based on @melissachadburn 's article in the @latimes today. /6

1022644225006088192.text: For the Julia Child workshop, it all worked out, but communication was spotty to nil. It took ages to get anything out of her, and I still never received a written receipt for taxes. In days leading up to the workshop, I was convinced I'd show up and no one would be there./5

1022644222774657025.text: She also gave me a special "low low" price if I booked on the spot, through the Paypal "friends and family" option. I always assumed people did this to avoid fees; it never occurred to me people did this to take the money and run./4

1022644221889667074.text: Towards the end of the workshop, #annamarch mentioned she was planning a new workshop in Ireland the following October. I lived in Berlin at the time, so flying to France was no big thing, and Ireland didn't seem like it either. She told me it would be in a castle./3

1022644220870516737.text: We were a diverse group of women from different backgrounds, different ages, different writing styles. What drew most of us together is that we were all divorced, divorcing, or unhappy in our relationships. We mined that a lot in our sessions, but our writing went beyond it./2

1022644219977129985.text: So, I first met #annamarch last December and found her charming, kooky, and a bit disorganized. This was at the Julia Child workshop (not the one mentioned in the article, but the second one). Surprisingly enough, it went off without a hitch./1
